titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the E. M. Harris papers, 1862-1864

did.abstract: Business correspondence of Harris; and a letter from his sister-in-law, Adaline A. Hollingsworth, concerning family matters, local news, prices, and provisions.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: E. M. Harris Papers, 1862-1864, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: E. M. Harris was a trader dealing in yarn, leather, and other items in Cartersville, Georgia. His wife was named Emma, and they had a child named Rosa. Another child was born in 1864.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Business correspondence of Harris; and a letter from his sister-in-law, Adaline A. Hollingsworth, concerning family matters, local news, prices, and provisions.
